body: nit: this message is good, but a little overwhelming for the user.  Perhaps split this up into two separate checks (sparseDims == sparseDims_) and (!shrinking_sparse_dims); you can save/repeat the message about different options in both cases.  It would also be nice if you listed what was changing, e.g. "changing the number of sparseDims from X to Y; shrinking the sparse dim shape from A to B".
